Class Navigation

java.lang.Object
  Navigation

public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object

Class that houses the commands related to navigation.

Version:
2.0 November 25 2013
Author:
Vanessa Jones, Christopher Petryna, Simon Lei, Taylor Dotsikas, Muhammad Hannan and Caroline Wu

Constructor Detail

Navigation

public Navigation(Odometer odo,
                  ObjectDetection od,
                  LightLocalizer ls,
                  HandleBlock hb,
                  int role,
                  int[] greenZone,
                  int[] redZone)
Class constructor

Parameters:
odo - imports Odometer
ls - imports LightLocalizer
od - imports ObjectDetection
hb - imports HandleBlock
role - the robot's role (garbage collector or builder)
greenZone - an array containing the bottom-left and top-right coordinates of the green zone
redZone - an array containing the bottom-left and top-right coordinates of the red zone
Method Detail

interpretBluetooth

public void interpretBluetooth(int[] greenZone,
                               int[] redZone,
                               int role)
A method that interprets bluetooth readings into values good for navigation.

Parameters:
greenZone - an array containing the bottom-left and top-right coordinates of the green zone
redZone - an array containing the bottom-left and top-right coordinates of the red zone
role - the robot's role

setSpeeds

public void setSpeeds(float lSpd,
                      float rSpd)
Sets the travel speed of the robot

Parameters:
lSpd - left motor speed
rSpd - right motor speed

setSpeeds

public void setSpeeds(int lSpd,
                      int rSpd)
Sets the travel speed of the robot

Parameters:
lSpd - left motor speed
rSpd - right motor speed

setFloat

public void setFloat()
Float the two motors jointly

goFindBlock

public void goFindBlock()
Method that tells the robot to travel in search for blue blocks

scanAheadForObstacle

public boolean scanAheadForObstacle()
Scans ahead for obstacle with ultrasonic sensor.

Returns:
true if there's no obstacle, false if there is

pickSafeRoute

public void pickSafeRoute()
Looks for a line intersection that isn't blocked or out of bounds.

getNextLineIntersection

public void getNextLineIntersection()
Stores the coordinates of the nearest line intersection in the robot's heading.

getRobotDirection

public java.lang.String getRobotDirection()
Returns the general heading of the robot.

Returns:
north, south, east or west in string form.

traverseATile

public void traverseATile()
Displaces the robot one tile. Relies on black line detection.

goGrabBlock

public void goGrabBlock(double[] coords)
Moves the robot to the detected blue block, robot will travel to inputs after it's grabbed the block

getShortestPathToDropZone

public void getShortestPathToDropZone()
Gives the shortest path to the drop zone. Doesn't take obstacles and restricted areas into account.

bringToDropZone

public void bringToDropZone()
Directs the robot along a path to the drop zone based on the calculations in the method getShortestPathToDropZone().

circumventObstacle

public void circumventObstacle()
Provides instructions for avoiding an obstacle while holding a blue block.

travelTo

public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm. Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate of travel destination
y - y-coordinate fo travel destination

turnTo

public void turnTo(double angle,
                   boolean stop,
                   int speed)
Tells robot to rotate to a specific angle.

Parameters:
angle - the angle the robot will rotate to.
stop - controls whether or not to stop the motors when the turn is completed.

travelBy

public int travelBy(double dist,
                    boolean wait)
Method which tells the robot to travel a certain distance, if boolean wait is false, the method will return immediately.

Parameters:
dist - the distance the robot will travel by.
wait - if false, method will return immediately.

rotateBy

public int rotateBy(double angle,
                    boolean wait)
Method which tells the robot to rotate a certain angle, if boolean wait is false, the method will return immediately.

Parameters:
angle - the angle the robot will rotate by.
wait - if false, method will return immediately.

turnRight

public void turnRight(boolean wait)
Tells robot to rotate 90 degrees clockwise from current heading.

Parameters:
wait - if true, the robot will wait until the turn is complete before performing another operation.

turnLeft

public void turnLeft(boolean wait)
Tells robot to rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise from current heading.

Parameters:
wait - if true, the robot will wait until the turn is complete before performing another operation.

isBoundary

public int isBoundary(int destX,
                      int destY)
Determines if travel path will collide with a wall or forbidden zone.

Parameters:
destX - x-coordinate of travel path.
destY - y-coordinate of travel path.
Returns:
true if travel path is bad, false if its good.

setfoundBlock

public void setfoundBlock(boolean found)
A set method for if the robot's found a blue block. Called by the ObjectDetection class
